reviewText:
Early Access Review

[Updated the 26/04/2015, scroll down to the end]

Let's present this Stalker impersonator" [Long review].

PLOT:

As a Stalker
date: a modern scavenger in the irradiated "Zone" of Tchernobyl
recommended:
you fight for power and fame against other Stalkers and horrible mutants.

LAYOUT:

You have 2 currency: bolts and gold
voteText: ammunitions
votesHelpful: items such as food/ medkits and bonuses (you don't need to use real curency to buy items in the game
votesTotal: contrary to the browser versions with microtransactions). Items are great and bring a fresh air to this kind of game
votesFunny: the only problem is that some fights became longuer and more complicate if you use all items availiable.\nAs an example 2 items gives you health
column17: gives you the ability to nuke the map and kill everybody. All items have a cooldown but in general the more bolts or gold you have the better the chances you have to best your opponent.\n\nIn the main menu you can buy gear
column19: your global stats and a browser to find matchs or even do some "jobs" to gain few bolts.\nTheses jobs are not in-game missions. You see a progression bar near the name of the mission: Kill rats
column21: ect... with a required amount of time. You can't fight during jobs
column22: so you have to wait for the result and it last for hours. The shortest ( 30 mins): "Killing Rats" gives you 4 bolts
column23: the longuest (8 hours) is "Exploring the Zone" and gives you 150 bolts . This system is not bad but forces to plan exactly when you will be back on the game. The job continues even if you're offline but all the progress will be lost if you cancel it to play a game !\n\nGold can be scavenged if you log on the game often (like Warframe log bonuses)
column24: if you win a match or get a new level. Gold serve most of the time to buy weapons
column25:
ammo and valuable items.
there is always a way to spend some bolts if you're short on gold but the gear won't be the best.


You gain experience by killing players
column26: it unlocks new levels and of course new gear to slaughter in mass. A good aspect of the item store is (contrary to the very bad Counter Strike Nexon)
column27:
ammo upgrades are granted forever and there is no time limitation for weapons.


But this is not a clone of Stalker
column29: no different characters.\n\nYou start with an uggly skin
column30: maybe the most usefull i've ever found on a fps.\nIt's a man who has blond hair and a head band
column31: to be fast: as if you had a target on the head...\nThe chacracters have strange  movements and ways to hold their weapons
column32: like in the inventory where the dummy you have to try you cloths holds a rifle in front of him but it doesn't aim straight.\nYou can customize them
column33: you can even buy a femal skin or masks.\nThe problem is: nearly all players doesn't change the skin of their characters. I choosed a dark cap and a dark armor and surprisingly... i was shot down quite rarely.\nAnd i'm not saying i have amazing skills in fps
column34:
read the following.


FIGHTS:

My pc for gaming is out of order
column35:
so i downloaded the game on my 5 years old laptop.
And the game is very slow. It's so slow that some times i just cannot shoot right in front of me.
So okay it's my problem and i assume it.

But with an average ping of 70
column36: i was deadly even with the basic sniper rifle. From lvl 1 to lvl 8 i had the upper hand (the 11/20/2014 after 5 hours on the game: I'm number 4 in the global ranking with 267 headshots for 465 kills so i've done around 57% kills with headshots... ). Fights are extremely boring. People are rushing mindlessly on enemy spawns and runs around players until their 4 secs of invincibility finish. In general when they doesn't fire at each other
column37: players spams grenades everywhere to have at least one kill (you have 5 grenades
column38: on a regular game with 10 players... you can imagine how "noisy" it can be sometimes). Even if the game gives special items such as traps or ways to summon beats and anomalies
column39: spawn camping and sniping are too much rewarding. Mutants are uggly
column40: they are far from the ones of Stalker except the pig
column41:
and it's the same for anomalies.


An example of a basic fight: behind a crate you explode dozens of heads
column42: raise your mp5 or better when a dude rushes at you
column43: throw grenades everywhere when you respawn in the bad spot. Continue that until you get a next level.\nOH ! ! !\nI was close to forgot that you have a radar to locate players and when somebody is close to you
column44:
you see his name with his health under floating trough walls and ceilings. You can't disable it !


But the worst is coming...

4 different game modes: Death Match
column47: Zombie.\nYou can host 10 or 16 players and you can enable or disable loadouts for players. Change the duration or select one of the few maps available (around 16 inspired of Stalker: Good point !).\nYou can choose 2 global lobby
column49: you start quite at ease. Sniping safely blond heads all the time and laughing when grenades are falling everywhere...\nAnd when you are at level 8
column50:
you can buy new cool gear but your new lobby is:
Lvl 8- to ..... LVL 60 !!!!!

Of course you can't give a level limit to the game you create.
And it's obvious that when you enter a game you are slaughtered by bigger levels in exoarmors (the best gives you 170 hp
column51: nearly 2 times the basic health without other upgrades) and of course heavy gear that kills you in one shot. The funny thing with theses players
column53:
they camp your spawn and farm you.
Frankly i would do the same but there is not fun to grind 52 levels by this method...
Especially in a game like this.

Because
column55: they dared to put a zombie mode.\nIn the first lobby
column56: you are infected by a virus
column57: it gives you 6000 hp and if you kill a human (with your 2 uggly arms that shakes as if you were dumb) he becames like you. Humans can shoot at you to slow you  or
column58: with luck and and tons of ammo
column59: to kill you. In general zombies wins due to overpowered stats. Allready annoying things turn bad when you go to the second lobby.\nEven with 6000 hp
column60:
human takes you down so quickly that you have no ways to do something.


Add to that the fact that nobody talks to you in english.
It's is like as a stupid guy who said during a game on TF2: "I have the right to say fu''' you without any reasons. Enjoy the magic of the internet !".
But frankly even on a game like Armed Assault where Russian and Ukrainian are numerous
column61:
they try at least to speak to you and the game is much deeper !

So you laugh in the first lobby in front of such a messy game and when you are cursed to level up and go to the second one... you cry. Maybe it's the voice they are talking about in the title...


TO CONCLUDE :

This game may have potential
column62:
if they really work to stick to a universe and a gameplay like the Stalker we know.

26/04/2015

Review update: They've added some new weapon skins and gave more balance to the second lobby (apparently) however the game is still buggy and the most important: boring. I've joined a game and like few months ago it's the same awfull player base and poor gameplay. Heavy machine guns that kills from 100 meters
column63:
or mindless rushs to the enemy spawn and being unable to counter attack because they have a clear view on you.... I only played 15 mins because i couldn't endure more.
Like the fact that they've kept the radar or the name floating above player models.

After 5 month nothing changed.

Voice of Pripyat is boring
column64: uggly and punishing.\nThis is not a game
column65: it's a torture... don't buy this game at any cost !\n\nN.B: I want to say again that this version has no item shop
column66: you pay for the title and the rest in unlockable via in-game play (contrary to the browser version)."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's pretty much a scam and nothing but. I don't even know what else needs to be said. It is not related to the STALKER franchise in any way and you'll easily get outclassed by anyone who spends money on it or has played it for an extended amount of time, because nothing is for free. The graphics don't help either, they remind me of Half Life 1, and it's not even a tactical shooter because you can see anyone's health bar and name when you are anywhere near them, even through walls. What is the point of that? It is also very crash happy, and the game modes are sub-standard. If you like this kind of game, you can at least do better and find one that only has the in-game purchases, but allows you to at least start playing w/o shelling out ten bucks on this piece of garbage. My word. The worst part is that nothing indicates the developers have any interest in improving anything about this game but the ingame store itself.

Here is some gameplay footage if you want to see more:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=soWtJDiuzBI

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWhy did i buy this terrible Stalker rip-off. It's sells itself as a 3D first-person shooter in a post-apocalyptic world. Zombies
hoursPlayed: intense realtime battles!" Well it's not
voteText: First off it's just a port of a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• web browser game with the same name. Second it looks like something a 9th grader made as an assignement. Graphics are horrible
helpfulPercent:
game is unoptimizied and the "art" is just something that the developer bought off unity store. The dev even stole the artwork from Stalker; I'm pretty sure that's illegal.

I wanted to believe this had any resemblence to stalker what-so-ever but it does not. Don't be as foolish as me. Don't buy this horrible web-game.

Buy Survarium instead.

1/10"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

okay observations thus far:

- it's unfinished, but it works for the most part.

- it's not really an MMO.  or maybe I don't understand.  it seemed to be like your standard 2 teams extremely dumbed-down shooter, about a dozen people in a match.  all of the players get experience points to buy upgrades and you get to go out there and grind again to get more experience.  I wouldn't really call that massive, but it's early access so who knows.  but being a facebook game, I don't see them making a true MMO out of this on a grand scale but if they could get the maps 20 times bigger and add tons more users it might start to feel like one.  to me I would say a game that has an inventory system, experience points and levels to have RPG-like characteristics, not MMO-like.  or maybe any RPG where you can play with your friends is an MMO, I'm not really up to speed with the lingo.  maybe there are lots of huge maps but i played 3 matches and 'quick match' at the top always brings you to the same map.  will check back again!

- lots of potential.

- there seem to be a lot of users already because of facebook.  this is a good thing because games are basically dead when no one plays online.  this game has that huge advantage where there is always people playing.  hopefully they can add some graphical abilities to the Steam-user side of things because the graphics seem toned down to the point where it looks like it was rendered in a browser.  I think they could do that though.  being the first day of release on Steam, I can't expect that to be done yet.  if they can't do that, then it's pretty much a bad facebook game that happens to be on Steam.  the graphics have a bit of a charm to them too, like if you wanted to play goldeneye-on-N64 graphics in an online FPS, this is a very well-functioning example of that.

- I can't see people on steam having access to so many FPS games sit down and actually play this game because of the gaming experience isn't a fraction of what you would get for your $10 elsewhere.  but I totally understand, it's far done and I am glad to contribute towards the end result.

- i've changed my review to negative.  i didn't like the idea of posting a negative review on launch day but maybe that would have been the better thing to do.  is is a pretty bad game overall, but like I mentioned earlier, they could turn it around with a budget, it could be a niche for those who want a budget fps.  the RPG-like elements are relatively unique.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game seems to be little more than an attempt at a cash grab. On the one hand, you are expected to pay for the game, but then, once you start playing it, it turns out its no different from any number of F2P games with in-game cash shops, and while it is possible to earn the in-game currency through play, we all know that in practice, not paying real money for the in-game currency for equipment and consumables will put you at a huge disadvantage against those who do.

Now, I do say attempt" above
hoursPlayed: redeeming quality that will probably save you from the temptation of throwing good money after bad

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nFirst of all, I did not buy this game outright, it was in a bundle. Voice of Pripyat is a MMO with very ugly graphics and terrible animations. The textures look like they are from the 90s. The gameplay is boring, clunky and uninspired. The zombie models are  amateurish, clumsy to play and very poorly animated. It has a fully featured pay-to-win store that has 2 currencies (gold and bolts). Voice of Pripyat is a port of a Facebook game you can play for free, which you should consider doing before paying money for this pile of rubbish.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's not bad.
It's in early access and allows people to come to the game through many different ways. Facebook, Steam, and it looks like a couple of other platforms. Is it a Facebook game, though? I'm not sure. It's on early access on Steam and has achievements and trading cards. With my short time playing it, I had a good time. I don't think this is going to become my favorite game, but it's a purely multiplayer stabby-shooty fest that isn't too awfully hard on system resources.

Sound

It's too loud, and it's kind of lame. It's early access, though, so not too many complaints.

Potential!

Huge potential. I believe this was gifted to me, and it just took me awhile to get around to playing it. The words post apocalyptic" get put onto any game
date: and I'm up for playing it. I think that's a twist to attract people like me to play this
recommended: since it really is just your typical clone of any basic multiplayer first person shooter.\n\nI like the leveling system
voteText: but it's very clearly an early access title. It's something to watch
helpfulPercent: but it feels like something that's not going to go anywhere in the long run.\n\n6/10 - cut the price down a bit and I would say it's a good multiplayer game
votesHelpful: but it's still just a bit too clumsy to charge 7 bucks for. For 5 bucks
votesTotal: you'll have a couple of hours of fun.\n\nThere are PLENTY of servers to play on."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I found this very easy to get into.
Main menu is intuitive and after laughing for a bit about the Lenin mask you can equip I wanted to try a short match only to see that when I eventually quit my session I had clocked 3h into the game already :D
Battles are intense and  really fun, especially when you get to artifacts like jumper, zombie summon scroll or Anomaly grenade. Anomalies are fun by themselves though, especially PSY anomaly with instant LSD effect :D

This is an early access review and from what I see is already implemented at early access release, I am very confident that there is plenty of nice stuff to be expected.
Therefor I recommend to get the game and support the Devs by doing so!
